selection_reasoning: The focus is now on the 'ratchet' mechanism and the two-stage alpha refinement discovered in trial_2_7. I will also carry forward the Barycentric approach to see if its superior constraint handling can be merged with the symmetric starting configurations to avoid the 'INVALID' errors seen in other symmetry-breaking attempts.

trial_selections.reasoning: Current best score (0.9971). It successfully used a 'ratchet' mechanism to break symmetry and refine the configuration using a two-stage alpha schedule in the Log-Sum-Exp objective.
Second best (0.9964). It provides a slightly different implementation of the symmetric initialization which can be used for cross-breeding or as an alternative starting point.

Uses Barycentric coordinates. While the score is lower (0.898), this coordinate system is more robust for keeping points inside the triangle and could be combined with the symmetric initialization strategy.
The best non-symmetric approach (0.9637). It serves as a strong baseline for global search methods that don't rely on the 3-fold symmetry prior.
